title: Jason Robinson interview: How England came from behind against Australia to win the World Cup in 2003
text:
Jason Robinson is sitting in the new North Stand at a redeveloped Headingley, reminiscing about a rugby career which made him the most successful cross-code player of all time.

Leeds, his home town, is where Robinson’s remarkable journey began with league side Hunslet, but it was the 15-man code – most notably England’s 2003 World Cup final win over Australia – which changed his life.

Sixteen years on and the sides meet on the highest stage once again, this time in Saturday’s quarter-final, and for Robinson memories of the 2017 final win in Sydney – courtesy of Jonny Wilkinson’s dropped goal in extra time – come flooding back.

Robinson was outjumped by Lote Tuqiri for Australia’s early opener,...
description: Jason Robinson is sitting in the new North Stand at a redeveloped Headingley, reminiscing about a rugby career which made him the most successful cross-code player of all time.
